chargeHist.descr: Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan D. Stevens was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan D. Stevens

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due NOT mailed to defendant with DNA form as defendant's address listed as 'Homeless'.

(11:00 AM case called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom.  
Defendant Nathan D. Stevens appeared by video, in custody in the Stanley Correctional Institution. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Nathan D. Stevens. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Attorney Hillestad advises has previously sent the defendant a plea questionnaire/waiver of rights form for a Chippewa County case, so the defendant is aware of the form and how a plea works.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant pleads No Contest to Amended Count 1: Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer without Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's No Contest plea and finds the defendant Guilty of Amended Count 1.

Court orders sentence as follows:
6 months jail with 215 days sentence credit concurrent with case 21CF419. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs. Any remaining charges are dismissed and read in.

Case called at 11:13 AM.
Defendant Nathan D. Stevens appeared by video, in custody from Stanley Correctional.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Nathan D. Stevens.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant indicates that he has not received the plea offer that Attorney Hillestad mailed to him. Attorney Hillestad recites the offer to the Defendant.
Defendant indicates he would like to accept the offer but parties stipulate to adjourn the Plea Hearing to finalize the offer.
STC: 10/12/22 at 11:00 AM (Via Zoom).
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:30 PM case called. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan D. Stevens appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared by phone for Nathan D. Stevens. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
There is an offer the State is going to send to the defense. A status conference is scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 11:00 AM (30 min via Zoom).
Arraignment on July 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Same as Complaint just renumbering from Counts 4-7 to Counts 1-4.
Arraignment on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:50 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan D. Stevens appeared by video, in custody (Dodge).  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Nathan D. Stevens. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
Case is referred to Branch 2 for ARGN.
Order Approving Request to Appear by Zoom
Dated 05/25/2022, Defendant's request to Court for hearings via Zoom.

Case called at 9:35 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nathan D. Stevens not in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Nathan D. Stevens. 
Attorney Rivard indicates the Defendant is in custody and he requested he not be brought over from the jail as he is requesting new dates.
Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 5/16/22 at 2:00 PM.
Hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
